name: Documentary Storm
tag_list: video, community, documentary, documentaries, film, short-films
overview:
DocumentaryStorm.com has become renown for its carefully curated collection of online documentaries in a variety of subjects. From science, to music, to history, philosophy, technology, culture, and health, DocumentaryStorm.com updates daily to its expansive collection of full-length documentaries. Drawing equally from independent filmmakers and big studio productions, the company works directly with the documentary community to supply and educate the public.

The company has a few objectives. First, DocumentaryStorm.com works with educators at the university and high school levels to legally distribute copyright approved documentary material. Secondly, the company works with independent producers to help fund-raise and distribute their films. Lastly, the company curates the best of popular open-source documentary channels such as PBS, NOVA, National Geographic, and the National Film Board, to introduce these channels to a wider audience.

Documentarystorm.com allows its users to post comments, share documentaries, and engage in intellectually stimulating conversation on a wide range of themes. The website has become the intersection between filmmaker and audience.
